Comment 8: 
I was never much in favor of making out-of-range indexes a compilation error, but, given
that we have done that, I think that the gccgo & go/types behaviour makes more sense.

I am not very worried about rejecting currently valid programs for this kind of thing. 
As far as I can see the only case that gc currently accepts is a constant slice of a
constant string, and I'm skeptical that anybody actually writes such a thing.
